definitions.definition: used to show that something is surprising, unusual, unexpected, or extreme:
examples: I don't even know where it is.
I tried to reason with him, but even as I started to explain what had happened he stood up to leave.

definitions.definition: used to say that if something is the case or not, the result is the same:
examples: Even if you take a taxi, you'll still miss your train.
I've thought about it so much, but even now I can't believe how lucky I was to survive the accident.

definitions.definition: despite what has just been said:
examples: I had a terrible headache, but even so I went to the concert.
Even though he left school at 16, he still managed to become prime minister.

definitions.definition: flat and smooth, or on the same level:
examples: We resurfaced the floor because it wasn't even.
Sheila was awarded a scholarship in chemistry, and now her brother has evened the score with a scholarship in economics.
